project.teaser: The ambition of the STREAM project (STREAM) is the creation of an innovative and robust flexibility ecosystem (“STREAM Ecosystem”) on the low voltage (LV) grid side of existing power markets connecting data, technologies, stakeholders and markets, thus facilitating the...
project.objective: The ambition of the STREAM project (STREAM) is the creation of an innovative and robust flexibility ecosystem (“STREAM Ecosystem”) on the low voltage (LV) grid side of existing power markets connecting data, technologies, stakeholders and markets, thus facilitating the flexibility provision. A variety of benefits for both technical- and non-technical aspects of energy services supporting power market and power grid operations will be created. STREAM will empower data from flexible devices and support creation of other citizen services through a User-centric Approach to improve their acceptance. The exploitation of both types of services will benefit from new business models, built upon local LV flexibility markets and novel barter-like mechanism, developed in STREAM. Presently, such services and business models don’t exist in either established- or developing power markets. The STREAM ecosystem covers their implementation, includes various stakeholder groups on all levels of power markets, from small-scale end-users, energy communities, ESCOs, service providers, to market- and system operators. To achieve the goals, STREAM consortium comprises relevant actors to capture the entire flexibility value chain within STREAM ecosystem from end users, energy communities to service providers, flexibility services providers, market operators, DSOs, and TSO, complemented by technology and research partners. The latter will supply knowledge in a form of STREAM tools that will enable the realization of STREAM ecosystem. They will be adapted, deployed, calibrated, and demonstrated in the 4 STREAM pilots that serve as a basis for benchmarking of STREAM ideas. They cover geographical, economic, size and type diversity of the consumers. While complementary, the pilots focus on a specific part of STREAM Ecosystem. The pilot partners have all the essential roles and authority to carry out the specified activities.
project.title: Streaming flexibility to the power system
project.keywords: demand response, flexibility market, business models, energy services, TSO, DSO

article.title: Ecosystem to meet flexibility demands of power market and grid operations

result.title: Use case and requirements definition
result.description: This deliverable will include the definition of the various use cases and stakeholder requirements, including setting up of relevant KPIs to ensure that impacts can be measured and validated.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan 2
result.description: This deliverable will present an update of D7.1 and present a plan for STREAM dissemination and communication activities from M18 till the end of the project with focus on STREAM ecosystem verification.

result.title: Periodic Reporting for period 2 - STREAM (Streaming flexibility to the power system)
result.teaser: STREAM project aims to create an innovative and robust flexibility ecosystem (“STREAM Ecosystem”) on the low voltage (LV) grid side of existing power markets connecting data, technologies, stakeholders and markets, thus facilitating the flexibility provision. A variety of...

category.title: Report Summary
category.description: Result: Publishable summary (FP7 SESAM) and Summary for publication (H2020 SyGMa)

webItem.alternativeText: Logotype of the project. Images will be updated in the following months.

result.title: sFLEX flexibility management
result.description: This deliverable will include the development of sFLEX STREAM tool, including device register design for registering flexibility assets within a given local market, hierarchal coordination within a given local market, and a grid priority evaluation framework (TLS).

result.title: sMART local market structure development
result.description: This deliverable will include the development of sMART STREAM tool, which will be used by flexibility services providers, aggregators and DSOs to manage flexibility planning and utilization on LV side of power networks and with various transaction structuring (traditional monetary or peer-to-peer/barter-like).

result.title: Exploitation and Business Plan 1
result.description: This deliverable will define the first version of Exploitation and Business Plan, that will be based on conclusions from the results of WP2's work.

result.title: Business models structuring
result.description: This report will provide – in a matrix format, a detailed overview of the proposed business models for different types of energy systems, use-cases and stakeholders with the purpose of providing a decision-making tool for scaling STREAM services according to the context of its intended application (deployment on a building-level, deployment of STREAM in an industrial zone, deployment within an Energy Community, etc.). The purpose of this report will be to provide a baseline for designing service and transaction structuring within a given proposed STREAM Ecosystem.

result.title: Dissemination and Communication Plan 1
result.description: This deliverable will include a comprehensive overview of STREAMs communication and dissemination activities as well as all of the projects public awareness communication and dissemination activities including barriers and successful formats for the first 18 months of the project

result.title: sGRID and sPLAN grid planning and service management tool
result.description: This deliverable will include the development of sGRID, a functional specification for integrating the developed open-platform and STREAM Ecosystem coordination methods into existing physical and ICT power network infrastructure that exists in pilot sites.

result.title: sDATA open-platform
result.description: This deliverable will include a functional specification and development of sDATA open-platform, which will allow the integration of data for energy and OTHER CONSUMER services into a standardized and interoperable interface framework. This will include a full specification & governance cycle for managing Open APIs.

result.title: User-centric service design and energy service design
result.description: This deliverable will include the identification and specification of the technical-services and consumer-services, which can be included in STREAM Ecosystem for the targeted user-groups within pilot sites and based on their needs/requirements, and which have the potential for scaling up & replicability in similar environments of similar context. This deliverable will also include the design of sENC STREAM tool, which will be used by Energy Community Operators for aggregating flexibility and optimize energy community members’ involvement in the local economy.

result.title: sDATA open-platform STREAM Ecosystem coordination methods
result.description: This deliverable will include a functional specification for ensuring the safety and security of data exchanged within STREAM Ecosystem, including the setting up of distributed ledger technologies and cybersecurity measures.

result.title: Conclusions & Regulatory aspects of local flexibility markets
result.description: This deliverable will include na overview of the various options for flexibility utilization in given local energy markets and within the context of the pilot sites, to include additional verification from a regulatory viewpoint to ensure that the tools developed and frameworks proposed are compliant with the relevant legislative requirements governing the energy sector in a given country/region.
